['Evelyn Witts, an expert in Linguistics with a specialization in Semantics and Etymology.', 'Witts earned her PhD in Linguistics from the University of Oxford, where she focused on Semantics and Etymology', 'Witts possesses an innate motivation to enhance her vocabulary continually', 'Witts can decipher archaic or uncommon words that appear in crosswords', 'On tap - This implies the item can be accessed or used immediately, like a keg of beer at a bar.', 'Abundant - An ample amount that is easily accessible without shortage.', 'Easily obtainable - Something one can acquire without difficulty.', 'Accessible - Within reach and easy to get to.', 'Obtainable on demand - Capability of acquiring something immediately when requested or needed.', 'At-hand - Available for immediate use; in close proximity.', 'Handy - Conveniently placed, readily available.', 'Quickly available - Something that can be accessed without delay.', 'Immediate - Ready to act now, instantaneously obtainable.', 'Instantly obtainable - Available at once; no waiting required.', "Convenient - Suitable for one's use and saving time or effort.", 'Readily accessible - Easily reached or available without any hindrance.', 'Within reach - Physically close enough to be grasped or obtained easily.', 'Available at short notice - Accessible with little preparation required.', 'Up-to-the-minute - The most recent; current and promptly available information.', 'Promptly available - Ready and accessible without delay.', 'Quick-fetching - Capable of being obtained quickly or easily.', 'Straightforward to obtain - Not complicated, easy to acquire.', 'Directly obtainable - Obtained with no obstacles; straightforward.', 'Instantaneously accessible - Immediately reachable without any wait time.']
